column4: I have a system running etch.. I download the .iso and burn it and then try to load.. it gets so far and then does a kernel panic... how do I get past such a challenge?
PErhaps check the kernel load line options used in etch and apply the same kernel options when booting from the livecd.
Also minimum specs met? 256Mb ram, etc etc
will the ubuntu disk allow me to set those specific boot parameters?
ok, how do I check my RAM?
Yes. Something like f5 or f6 at cd menu then add whatever appropriate kernel options at end of line (before the --- )
You don't know how much ram your box has ? ;)
well, I havent' looked or check that box in a while... I meant, can I check it with /proc/mem or something?
looks like I have 500 mb RAM in that machine..
OK. So enough to run the livecd. Likely then some idiosyncratic kernel option then
eg:  look at the kernel line which currently loads your etch and make note of the options used. Use the same options off the ubuntu livecd kernel load line
fine, but I can ping that same IP for mirrors.xmission.com JUST fine.. would I be able to do that, sans internet connection?
Try surf to http://mirrors.xmission.com/ubuntu/dists/hardy              <or ibex or so>
that brings up a menu listing main, multiverse, restricted and universe...
Then check your sources.list entry for that repository
